content: 100% that witch tsuki mountain fibres level of difficulty / skills required level intermediate skills needed knowledge of stockinette stitch 1x1 ribbing increasing & decreasing picking up stitches german short row reading colorwork charts stranded colorwork and 3 color stranded colorwork materials yarn dk weight yardage is a guestimate and will be more acurate once the mkal is over see yardages below supplies u s 4 3 5mm circular knitting needles for neck and bottom ribbing or preferred needles of choice in size needed to get gauge u s 6 4mm circular knitting needles for body and sleeves or preferred needles of choice in size needed to get gauge u s 4 3 5mm dpns for sleeve cuffs or magic loop method or preferred needles of choice in size needed to get gauge 16 circular needle 30 + circular needle or preferred needles needed to knit the chosen bust circumference scissors tapestry needle for weaving in ends 10+ stitch markers have one different to mark your bor waste yarn or spare circular needles / cables for holding sleeve stitches gauge washed and blocked on u s 6 needles 20x26 stitches = 4 / 10cm colorwork in the round 20x28 stitches = 4 / 10cm stockinette stitch in the round 1 tsuki mountain fibres i 100% that witch sweater #thatwitchsweater stitches / abbreviations / techniques k - knit p - purl bobble - bind off co - cast on bor - beginning of the round k2tog - knit two stitches together long tail cast on - https //www youtube com/watch v=sn9cneozolc cable cast on - https //www youtube com/watch v=cmaiyuhhlt8&t=387s jssbo - jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off https //www youtube com/watch v=cmaiyuh cid 0 hlt8&t=387s gsr - german short row https //www youtube com/watch v=a3s9cl47pyw m1l - insert the left hand needle from front to back under the bar between the stitches knit this bar through the back loop m1r - insert the left hand needle from back to front under the bar between the stitches knit this bar through the front loop ssk - slip two stitches knitwise individually then knit them together through the back loop * - repeat to the end of the row notes this sweater is constructed from the neck down with a stranded colorwork yoke then separated into body and sleeves the stitches for the sleeves are put on scrap yarn or spare needles while you form the body then bind off afterwards you form one sleeve at a time sizing this sweater was designed to include between 2 and 4 inches of positive ease to measure with ease measure around the fullest part of your bust and add your preferred amount of ease then knit to the closest size for that number if you are in between sizes it is usually better to go up a size rather than down a size remember to choose a size based on your blocked gauge not your raw gauge 2 tsuki mountain fibres i 100% that
